titleStmt.title: Plain dealing with England in matter of conscience, between the King and Parliament. I. Concerning the Kings most excellent Majesty. II. Concerning the Parliament. III. Concerning the grand Reformers. IV. Concerning the Parliaments army. V. Concerning those called Malignants. VI. Concerning the Cavaliers.

notesStmt.note: An attack chiefly upon the Cavaliers, detailing their supposed cruelties.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
